TopicTitle: What mod removes the engineer-EVA right-click option to delete a part?

Articles.Content:
I remember using the right click option to blow up unnecessary parts with engineers in EVA a lot during my last career. I think its a stock-option, but not sure. I am now playing with RSS + RO and many other mods that I havent used before and I dont get that option in EVA anymore.

Since the ability to remove individual parts is a key-elemtent of my planned orbital assembly projects, I would like to get this option back. Does anyone know how?

My current GameData folder:
That option isn't actually stock, it comes from MKS/OKS.

That option isn't actually stock, it comes from MKS/OKS.

That explains it. I had MKS/OKS installed all the time. But not now anymore since its to RAM-hungry and doesnt fit well into a RO setting.

Thank you for the quick reply!

Now I have to figure out a workarround or how to integrate just that feature of MKS/OKS.
No, MKS/OKS isn't RAM hungry, and you'd have to ask Roverdude about that function.

No, MKS/OKS isn't RAM hungry,

Considering I'd just need a tiny bit of code, it certainly is.

Considering I'd just need a tiny bit of code, it certainly is.

In that sense, yeah, but seriously, it isn't RAM hungry.

Anyways, I think you might be able to get away with the MM config for scrap/salvage, but I don't know what lets you actually explode the part.
You can solve, partially, this problem with KIS/KAS, that you have installed.

...

Since the ability to remove individual parts is a key-elemtent of my planned orbital assembly projects, I would like to get this option back. Does anyone know how?

My current GameData folder:

http://i.imgur.com/Fw3YSYB.jpg

Since you already have KIS/KAS installed why not simply use an engineer to remove an object?

Edit: Darn, never expected to be ninja'd with nearly the same answer on an hour old thread.
If you just want to destroy parts of your ship, check out Kaboom!

If you just want to destroy parts of your ship, check out Kaboom!

Thank you! That mod is exactly what I need.
